meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred
meanings.sent1: The family enshrined the old photo in a special frame.
meanings.sent2: She enshrines her grandmother's recipes by cooking them every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be enshrining the new toy mouse as its favorite plaything.
meanings.sent4: The small town enshrined the memory of its founder in a statue at the center square.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition of enshrining wisdom in stories has been passed down for generations.

meanings.definition: To enclose in or as if in a shrine
meanings.sent1: The jeweler enshrined the precious gem in a beautiful gold pendant.
meanings.sent2: The museum enshrines artifacts from different eras for visitors to admire.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be enshrining their secret treasure in a hidden cave.
meanings.sent4: The artist enshrined her memories of the seaside in a series of paintings.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization enshrined their beliefs in magnificent temples.

meanings.definition: To protect or cherish as sacred
meanings.sent1: The knight vowed to enshrine the princess from any harm.
meanings.sent2: The community enshrines the tradition of helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The gardener seemed to be enshrining the rare flower by placing a fence around it.
meanings.sent4: The tribe enshrined the ancient rituals in their ceremonies to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The artist enshrined the beauty of nature in every brushstroke of the painting.
